nameEntry.part: Ministerial Advisory Council on Child Protection [I, Western Australia]

biogHist.abstract: A Ministerial Advisory Council on Child Protection was established on 30 January 2003 with an independent chairperson. The multi-discipinary committee included senior representatives from government and non-government agencies, and members of the community. The Council advised the Minister on child protection matters. This Ministerial Advisory Council was still active in 2007 and possibly did not conclude until the end of the Carpenter Labor government's term of office in September 2008.

cpfRelation.relationEntry: Children and Young People in Care Advisory Committee (2002 - 2003?)
Ministerial Advisory Council on Child Protection [II, Western Australia] (2009 - )

descriptiveNote.p: It has been part of the practice of child welfare in Western Australian for the Minister to appoint an advisory body.
Since 2004, a Ministerial Advisory Council has provided advice to the Minister on child protection issues.
